comments:
The fix for bug 180674 removed one of the conditions from the if in setSelectionBackground(*)

it used to be:
//The colors array can optionally have an extra entry which describes the highlight top color
//Thus its either one or two larger than the percents array
if (percents == null || 
! ((percents.length == colors.length - 1) || (percents.length == colors.length - 2))){
    SWT.error(SWT.ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT);
}

but is now:

if (percents == null || percents.length != colors.length - 1) {

This is causing an IllegalArgumentException which is preventing my self-hosted eclipse with a clean workspace from coming up.

But I think our changes in HEAD need the swt from HEAD, and that's why I had runtime problems.

Yes that's correct, UI changes were dependent on SWT changes which were released the day before.
